news.Title: [AI Summary] Global Unichip (3443.TW) Revenue Hits Record High on North American CSP Projects, Foreign Investors Continue Buying
news.Content:
Taiwanese ASIC and silicon IP provider Global Unichip (3443.TW) has been under market spotlight recently. According to UDN Economic Daily News, HSBC raised Global Unichip's target price, citing a larger-than-expected scale of its CSP CPU project (2025/11/01). Liberty Times reported that Global Unichip is actively expanding its AI ASIC orders, having secured projects from multiple major North American CSPs (Cloud Service Providers), which are expected to materialize by the end of the year, driving revenue growth in the coming year. September consolidated revenue hit a record monthly high (2025/11/01).

In terms of specific revenue figures, September consolidated revenue reached NT$3.613 billion, a 30.5% MoM increase and a 104.8% YoY increase. Third-quarter consolidated revenue was NT$8.61 billion, a 41.1% QoQ increase and a 30.3% YoY increase. Cumulative consolidated revenue for January to September was NT$21.74 billion, a 14.3% YoY increase (Liberty Times, 2025/11/01). Buoyed by the positive revenue news, Global Unichip's stock price once hit the daily limit, reaching a 16-month high (Liberty Times, 2025/11/01).

Analysts are generally optimistic about Global Unichip's future development. Foreign investors have been net buyers, accumulating nearly 5,200 shares (Liberty Times, 2025/11/01). Global Unichip's General Manager, Shanny Dai, expressed optimism about the company's revenue growth in the coming years (Liberty Times, 2025/11/01). However, Global Unichip previously projected during an investor conference that the third-quarter gross profit margin and operating profit margin would decrease by several percentage points compared to the previous quarter, and that the full-year gross profit margin might be lower than last year, primarily due to increased mass production and a decline in NRE (Non-Recurring Engineering) business (Liberty Times, 2025/11/01). The company will focus on increasing NRE order intake and realization rates to improve overall gross profit margin (Liberty Times, 2025/11/01).

In addition, Global Unichip is adjusting its revenue structure, increasing the proportion of the US market to over 50%-60% while reducing the proportion of the Chinese market to below 20% (Liberty Times, 2025/11/01). Recent trading by investment trusts has shown both buying and selling activity, indicating differing views among institutional investors regarding Global Unichip's future prospects (Liberty Times, 2025/11/01).
